material.mattext: People who spend the most time at the computer are likely to choose the new software with a very technical-sounding name, and they tend to have a low level of satisfaction for any product.

Incorrect. Actually comp, hours spent on the computer, is the right answer. We'll never know whether the low level of satisfaction of this new software is because users really did not like it, or because those who chose it spend a lot of time on the computer. People who tend to spend a lot of time on the computer will tend to choose this software due to it name, and those people also tend to have low levels of satisfaction.
